title: Hard Starting or Long Crank
symptom_short: Engine cranks for a long time before starting

likely_causes.cause: Weak fuel pump or fuel pressure bleeding down

recommended_checks: Listen for fuel pump prime sound when key is turned ON.
Check for fuel smell after extended cranking.
safety_warning: Repeated long cranking can drain the battery and overheat the starter.

title: Loss of Power Under Acceleration or Load
symptom_short: Vehicle lacks power when accelerating or climbing hills
recommended_checks: Check maintenance history for fuel filter replacement.
safety_warning: Sudden loss of power during passing can be dangerous.

title: Poor Fuel Economy
symptom_short: Fuel mileage significantly worse than normal
recommended_checks: Check fuel trims with scan tool.
safety_warning: Poor fuel economy itself is not dangerous but may indicate underlying issues.

title: Fuel Smell Around or Inside Vehicle
symptom_short: Strong fuel smell inside or around the car

likely_causes.cause: Fuel leak at lines, injectors, or tank

recommended_checks: Do not smoke or use open flames near the vehicle.
Inspect under vehicle for fuel drips.
Ensure gas cap is tight and seal is intact.
safety_warning: Fuel leaks are a serious fire hazard. Avoid driving until resolved.

title: EVAP System Leak or Check Engine Light
symptom_short: Check engine light related to EVAP system

likely_causes.cause: Cracked EVAP hose or faulty purge valve

recommended_checks: Clear codes and monitor if they return.
safety_warning: EVAP leaks rarely affect drivability but increase emissions.
